text: it's been confirmed that the House of
Commons will sit in emergency session on
Saturday the 19th of October to consider
the way forward on brexit the last time
the House met on a Saturday was during
the Falklands conflict nearly 40 years
ago the session will take place a few
days after the EU summit which is widely
seen as the last chance to agree a
brexit deal before the deadline of
October the 31st the former Foreign
Secretary Jeremy Hunt told the BBC
tonight that he feared a catastrophic
failure in statecraft from the European
Union and accused them of failing to
understand British politics as Laura
Coons Bergner tells us not just Her
Majesty will smell the new paint a quick
makeover before the week when the Prime
Minister's political hopes might really
do or die
